title: Neural Chameleons: Language Models Can Learn to Hide Their Thoughts from Unseen Activation Monitors
summary: Activation monitoring, which probes a model's internal states using lightweight classifiers, is an emerging tool for AI safety. However, its worst-case robustness under a misalignment threat model--where a model might learn to actively conceal its internal states--remains untested.
